location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.233 of 1851 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commanding Indian Naval Squadron, Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Hennell writes that he has received news that members of the Uttoobee ['UtÅ«b] tribe from Kenn [Kish] Island, have broken the ruler of Bahrain's blockade of the harbour at Kateef [al-Qatif]. Hennell continues that this action took place against British injunctions, and requests Porter to capture any vessels belonging to the Utub tribe in the vicinity of Bahrain, and to prevent the Wahhabi forces from leaving al-Qatif by boat.
